name: Accidental Wrong UPI Transfer Scam
description: Scammer claims to have accidentally transferred money to the victim's number and emotionally manipulates them into sending money to a scam UPI ID.

turns.scammer_message: Hello, I mistakenly transferred Rs 10,000 to your number instead of someone else. This is a genuine mistake. Can you please send it back to my UPI? I'm a poor daily wage worker.
turns.notes: Initial emotional bait with accidental transfer story.

turns.scammer_message: Sir, please check your bank account. I sent Rs 10,000 by mistake to your mobile number. My UPI ID is dailywage.return@ybl. Please return the money, it is my entire week's wages. I have a sick mother at home and I need this money for her medicines.
turns.notes: Scammer reveals UPI ID with emotional backstory.

turns.scammer_message: I know you are a good person sir. Just transfer Rs 10,000 back to dailywage.return@ybl. You can also call me on +91-7799881122 to verify. I am Ramesh, a construction worker from Bhopal. This money was supposed to go to the material supplier but I entered the wrong number.
turns.notes: Scammer provides fake identity details and phone number to build trust.

turns.scammer_message: Sir, I am folding my hands and requesting you. My family will sleep hungry tonight without this money. Please send Rs 10,000 to dailywage.return@ybl. If you don't believe me, call me at +91-7799881122 and I will show you the transaction screenshot. I am an honest working man, please help.
turns.notes: Intensified emotional manipulation, repeating both intelligence items.

turns.scammer_message: Sir, this is my last request. I have been trying for hours. Please have mercy and return my hard-earned Rs 10,000 to dailywage.return@ybl. My number is +91-7799881122. If you don't return it, I will have to go to the cyber cell. I don't want to do that because I know it was just a mistake. Please do the right thing.
turns.notes: Final turn combining emotional appeal with veiled legal threat, all intelligence repeated.
